data.meta_description: As Veteran Actress Waheeda Rehman Wins The 53rd Dadasaheb Phalke Award, Here's The Full List Of All Awardees So Far (1969-2021).
data.text:
The coveted Dadasaheb Phalke Lifetime Achievement Award, popularly known as Dadasaheb Phalke Award is India's highest award in the field of cinema. The award is presented annually at the National Film Awards ceremony by the Directorate of Film Festivals. For the unversed, DFF is an organisation set up by the Ministry of Information and Broadcasting.

Actress Waheeda Rehman is the most recent winner of this honour!

Before we move ahead to know everyone who has ever won this award, let us clear up any confusion that you might have later. So, this award was started 16 years after the National Film Awards began (1969). Hence, the most recent winner is the 53rd awardee of this honour. Again, to clarify, so far NFA has announced awards till 2021 only.

The National Film Awards is currently running two years late because of the Covid-19 pandemic.

Also Read: 69th National Film Awards Full Winners List! A Look At Everyone Who Won Big For The Year 2021

Let’s dive into details about all the winners of Dadasaheb Phalke Award so far!

*NFA - National Film Award

*DFA - Dadasaheb Phalke Award

Ceremonial Year Recipient NFA Year/DFA Year 2021 Waheeda Rehman 69th/53rd 2020 Asha Parekh 68th/52nd 2019 Rajnikanth 67th/51st 2018 Amitabh Bachchan 66th/50th 2017 Vinod Khanna 65th/49th 2016 Kasinathuni Viswanath 64th/48th 2015 Manoj Kumar 63rd/47th 2014 Shashi Kapoor 62nd/46th 2013 Gulzar 61st/45th 2012 Pran 60th/44th 2011 Soumitra Chatterjee 59th/43rd 2010 K. Balachander 58th/42nd 2009 D. Ramanaidu 57th/41st 2008 V. K. Murthy 56th/40th 2007 Manna Dey 55th/39th 2006 Tapan Sinha 54th/38th 2005 Shyam Benegal 53rd/37th 2004 Adoor Gopalakrishnan 52nd/36th 2003 Mrinal Sen 51st/35th 2002 Dev Anand 50th/34th 2001 Yash Chopra 49th/33rd 2000 Asha Bhosle 48th/32nd 1999 Hrishikesh Mukherjee 47th/31st 1998 B. R. Chopra 46th/30th 1997 Kavi Pradeep 45th/29th 1996 Sivaji Ganesan 44th/28th 1995 Rajkumar 43rd/27th 1994 Dilip Kumar 42nd/26th 1993 Majrooh Sultanpuri 41st/25th 1992 Bhupen Hazarika 40th/24th 1991 Bhalji Pendharkar 39th/23rd 1990 Akkineni Nageswara Rao 38th/22nd 1989 Lata Mangeshkar 37th/21st 1988 Ashok Kumar 36th/20th 1987 Raj Kapoor 35th/19th 1986 B. Nagi Reddy 34th/18th 1985 V. Shantaram 33rd/17th 1984 Satyajit Ray 32nd/16th 1983 Durga Khote 31st/15th 1982 L. V. Prasad 30th/14th 1981 Naushad 29th/13th 1980 Paidi Jairaj 28th/12th 1979 Sohrab Modi 27th/11th 1978 Raichand Boral 26th/10th 1977 Nitin Bose 25th/9th 1976 Kanan Devi 24th/8th 1975 Dhirendra Nath Ganguly 23rd/7th 1974 Bommireddy Narasimha Reddy 22nd/6th 1973 Ruby Myers (Sulochana) 21st/5th 1972 Pankaj Mullick 20th/4th 1971 Prithviraj Kapoor 19th/3rd 1970 Birendranath Sircar 18th/2nd 1969 Devika Rani 17th/1st

On 26th September, Union Minister for I&B and Youth Affairs & Sports, GoI - Anurag Thakur announced Waheeda as the recent recipient.

He took to Twitter and wrote, “I feel an immense sense of happiness and honour in announcing that Waheeda Rehman ji is being bestowed with the prestigious Dadasaheb Phalke Lifetime Achievement Award this year for her stellar contribution to Indian Cinema.”

Thakur continued, “Waheeda ji has been critically acclaimed for her roles in Hindi films, prominent among them, Pyaasa, Kaagaz Ke Phool, Chaudhavi Ka Chand, Saheb Biwi Aur Ghulam, Guide, Khamoshi and several others. In her career spanning over 5 decades, she has essayed her roles with extreme finesse, leading to a National Film Award for her role as a clanswoman in the film "Reshma and Shera.”

“A Padma Shri and Padma Bhushan awardee, Waheeda ji has exemplified dedication, commitment and the strength of a Bharatiya Nari who can achieve the highest level of professional excellence with her hard work.”

In his ending note, Anurag shared, “At a time when the historic Nari Shakti Vandan Adhiniyam has been passed by Parliament, her being awarded this lifetime achievement award is a fitting tribute to one of the leading ladies of Indian Cinema and one who has dedicated her life after films to philanthropy and the greater good of society.”

“I congratulate her and humbly pay my regards to her rich body of work that is an intrinsic part of our film history.”

All the awardees of the 69th National Film Awards (2021) have already been announced but the physical event is yet to take place.
